content.webTitle: Financial firms stage biggest disaster rehearsal

fields.headline: Financial firms stage biggest disaster rehearsal
fields.bodyText: Britain's financial services industry will today go through what is being billed as the world's largest exercise in disaster planning - simulating a major event and monitoring the impact on financial markets. The simulation will involve 80 banks, insurers and brokers, as well as the financial authorities and police. Details are being kept under wraps, but companies will be accounting for staff, stabilising their financial dealings and dealing with the emergency services and media. A similar exercise last year is said to have helped the City during July's terror attacks in London.
